cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slowing while tracking west-northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to turn north and northeast along the upper Texas coast and into Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central–upper Texas coast near Matagorda Bay/San Luis Pass area (just southwest of Galveston)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning; Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX (tropical-storm watch segment)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA for tropical storm; Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA for storm surge (includes Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper and middle Texas coast including Galveston Bay and southwestern Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–50 mph) with higher gusts likely Monday into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water levels in Galveston Bay could rise 3–5 ft above normally dry ground if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with locally up to 20 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents already affecting the coast
